required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Study of SmartQuit, a Smartphone-Based Smoking Cessation Program

brief_summary.textblock: This trial investigates how well a smartphone-based smoking cessation program called SmartQuit works to help patients stop smoking. SmartQuit is an smartphone application-based smoking cessation program that includes a defined program consisting of interactive evidence-based exercises for dealing more effectively with urges to smoke, a place to track desired behaviors, personalized plans for quitting, and a certificate of completion once the recommended program components are completed. SmartQuit may help patients quit smoking, lower healthcare costs and reduce premature tobacco-related deaths.

detailed_description.textblock:
OUTLINE:
Patients use the SmartQuit program to learn and practice skill modules as often as they wish over 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with 7-day cigarette smoking cessation at 2 months.
primary_outcome.description: No smoking at all in the past 7 or more days (7-day point prevalence quit rate).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in number of cigarettes smoked per day

secondary_outcome.description: Differences in a participant's readiness to quit will be assessed by comparing their responses to the baseline survey readiness to quit questions with their responses to the 2 month follow-up survey
Participants will share their nicotine dependence level via survey at their 2 month follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of times logged into the application
secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed via 2 month follow-up survey
Will be assessed via 2 month follow-up survey
Will be assessed via 2 month follow-up survey

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant opinion of the usefulness of the application for quitting smoking
secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed via 2 month follow-up survey

arm_group.description: Patients use the SmartQuit program to learn and practice skill modules as often as they wish over 6 months.

intervention.intervention_name: SmartQuit Smoking and Tobacco Cessation Program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Smokes at least five cigarettes daily for at least past 12 months
- Wants to quit in the next 30 days
- Interested in learning skills to quit smoking
- Resides in United States (US)
- Has at least daily access to their own smartphone
- Knows how to login and download a smartphone application from their smartphone
- Willing and able to read in English
- Not participating in other smoking cessation interventions (including our other intervention studies)
- Must be an employee of a company who is participating in recruitment
- Willing to complete one follow-up survey
- Provide email, phone, and mailing address

overall_official.affiliation: Fred Hutch/University of Washington Cancer Consortium

facility.name: Fred Hutch/University of Washington Cancer Consortium
